body_html:
Also, I'm curious, see any performance diff with intel compiler v msvc? On Mon, Apr 30, 2018 at 10:52 PM, Benjamin Striner <bstriner@gmail.com> wrote:
…
Not officially, but could copy FindMKL or something similar into tensorflow. Would be better organization but would need to check licensing. BTW, it is MKLROOT that intel sets (at least in my experiments). Seems like we should check for -fopenmp /Qopenmp and /openmp? I assume FindOpenMP hits those correctly. On Mon, Apr 30, 2018 at 10:29 PM, fo40225 ***@***.***> wrote: > CMake didn't have officially FIndMKL, I think use MKL_ROOT is enough. > > Use the functions provided by cmake as much as possible because that > there is not only msvc compiler on windows. > > For example, if you use Intel compiler on windows, you need use /Qopenmp > to enable OpenMP; it is different from msvc or gnu-compliant compiler. > > I have successfully built tensorflow on windows using the intel compiler. > I think it is also possible to build tensorflow on windows by gcc in MSYS2 > or clang for windows. > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#18973 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AL4rbIu6BgaAYaa4EVvsx9yC4nn1LQApks5tt8iSgaJpZM4TsLFx> > . >
body_text:
Also, I'm curious, see any performance diff with intel compiler v msvc?

On Mon, Apr 30, 2018 at 10:52 PM, Benjamin Striner <bstriner@gmail.com>
wrote:
…
 Not officially, but could copy FindMKL or something similar into
 tensorflow. Would be better organization but would need to check licensing.
 BTW, it is MKLROOT that intel sets (at least in my experiments).

 Seems like we should check for -fopenmp /Qopenmp and /openmp? I assume
 FindOpenMP hits those correctly.

 On Mon, Apr 30, 2018 at 10:29 PM, fo40225 ***@***.***>
 wrote:

> CMake didn't have officially FIndMKL, I think use MKL_ROOT is enough.
>
> Use the functions provided by cmake as much as possible because that
> there is not only msvc compiler on windows.
>
> For example, if you use Intel compiler on windows, you need use /Qopenmp
> to enable OpenMP; it is different from msvc or gnu-compliant compiler.
>
> I have successfully built tensorflow on windows using the intel compiler.
> I think it is also possible to build tensorflow on windows by gcc in MSYS2
> or clang for windows.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#18973 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AL4rbIu6BgaAYaa4EVvsx9yC4nn1LQApks5tt8iSgaJpZM4TsLFx>
> .
>
body:
Also, I'm curious, see any performance diff with intel compiler v msvc?

On Mon, Apr 30, 2018 at 10:52 PM, Benjamin Striner <bstriner@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Not officially, but could copy FindMKL or something similar into
> tensorflow. Would be better organization but would need to check licensing.
> BTW, it is MKLROOT that intel sets (at least in my experiments).
>
> Seems like we should check for -fopenmp /Qopenmp and /openmp? I assume
> FindOpenMP hits those correctly.

> wrote:
>
>> CMake didn't have officially FIndMKL, I think use MKL_ROOT is enough.
